Ulcerative colitis

Crohn's disease
  • Affects Colon
  • Starts from rectum
  • Goes up in retrograde fashion
  • Continuous manner
  • Backwash ileitis
  • Any part from the mouth to anus
  • Skip lesions
  • Stomach - Ram's horn stomach appearance
  • M/c site - terminal ileum
  • Submucosal
  • Complete ulcer - transmural ulcer ·
    • Fistula
    • Abscess
  • Lead pipe colon
  • Toxic megacolon
  • String sign of Kantor - Terminal ileum
  • Rose thorn ulcers
  • Barium study first sign - mucosal granularity
  • Aphthous ulcer

  • ↳ Option A - 80% of boys: This option is incorrect. Percentile lines on the WHO growth charts do not directly represent a percentage of the population but are specific reference points used to assess child growth relative to a healthy population.
  • ↳ Option A - 80% of boys:
  • ↳ Option B - 50% of girls: This is incorrect because the 50% reference does not specifically denote an actual percentile line on the chart. The WHO growth charts use percentiles such as the 3rd, 50th, and 97th to represent standard deviations of growth in the population.
  • ↳ Option B - 50% of girls:
  • ↳ Option D - 3rd percentile for girls: This option is incorrect as the 3rd percentile represents a lower boundary line on the growth chart, indicating children who are at the lower end of the growth spectrum (often used as a cutoff for undernutrition or stunting). It does not correspond to the uppermost line.
  • ↳ Option D - 3rd percentile for girls:

questions.text: The given type of sampling is?
questions.explanation: Correct Option C - Stratified Random Sampling

questions.text: What is the first-line treatment for a 20-year-old female with a history of binge eating followed by self-induced vomiting, a sense of lack of control over eating during these episodes, and calluses on the knuckles of her hands?

questions.text: Which of the following conditions is most likely associated with these findings?

questions.text: Which of the following best explains the pathophysiology of sarcoidosis?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Activation of Th2 lymphocytes leading to the production of interleukin-4 (IL-4)

options.label: C
options.text: Direct activation of B lymphocytes by mycobacterial antigens

options.label: D
options.text: Impaired phagocytosis by macrophages due to decreased CD8 cell activity

questions.correct_answer: A. Activation of Th1 lymphocytes leading to the production of γ-interferon

questions.text: Which of the following accurately describes the mechanism of action of class 3 antiarrhythmic drugs?

options.label: A
options.text: They primarily block sodium channels, decreasing the phase 0 slope of the action potential

options.label: B
options.text: They inhibit calcium influx into cardiac cells, reducing the duration of action potential

options.label: C
options.text: They block potassium channels, increasing the duration of action potential and risk of QT prolongation

options.label: D
options.text: They enhance beta-adrenergic receptor activity, leading to increased contractility of the heart:

questions.correct_answer: C. They block potassium channels, increasing the duration of action potential and risk of QT prolongation
questions.explanation: Correct Option C
